exm.mng: a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer, fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions, ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
exm.pyn: chéng mén shī huǒ , yāng jí chí yú

exm.mng: Accumulated evil will be repaid in suffering (idiom).

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer, fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions, ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
exm.pyn: chéng mén shī huǒ , yāng jí chí yú

exm.mng: to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
